page.title: 20TRANSPORT:WOODTON AREA
page.content: For many of the people here transport means having their own car;only about 12% of families have no car at all,& of those who do have cars,nearly 40% have 2 or more cars.Those dependent on public transport are fairly well serv- ed by the Eastern Counties Omnibus Co, which runs a service from Norwich to Halesworth via the B1332,diverting through Woodton Street.This service is roughly hourly on weekdays & Saturdays but runs less frequently on Sunday.It enables people to visit Bungay for shopping or the doctor,& Norwich for shopping or entertainment,though the latter is constrained by an inadequate evening service.There is a connection in Bungay with buses for Harleston or Beccles & Lowestoft.The Woodton W.I. offers a 'taxi' service in emergenc- ies.(Researched & written by Hedenham & Woodton W.I.s & families & friends)
